fields.description: When working with the Class object from an uploaded plugin, it seems that the 'Class.getClasses()' method is broken. It should return the complete list of all classes and interfaces from both the specific class and any superclasses. Unfortunately, it always returns an empty array. This makes it tricky to do some reflection-based work, and could quite possibly break a few other libraries such as XStream.
fields.summary: Class.getClasses() for uploaded plugins returns an empty array.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7794].
{panel}
Currently, in the rich text editor, if one uses a number list and then uses, say, a bullet, and then continues with a number list, the numbering restarts. We would like to be able to continue the numbering when that happens.

 
h3. Summary

When using numbered lists we, as a user, might need to insert complex text formatting between list numbers. Currently, this is only possible by using the SHIFT+ENTER method, which indents the text.

 
h3. Why is this important

Numbered lists may require complex text formatting within each list number (technical documents for example) and using the SHIFT+ENTER option indents text and can break the visual parameters needed for the documentation.

Also, having a feature that allows the user to simply determine that the numbered list count should start from where it left prior to this moment is easier than using SHIFT+ENTER with each line break.

 
h3. Workaround

Use SHIFT+ENTER to create a new line without affecting the numbering.
fields.summary: Implement a feature that allows to continue numbering on numbered lists

fields.description:
User's permissions are ignored when set up by admin.
For instance, create a user and only set the 'view' permission to TRUE.
The newly created user is able to still add comments.

Please confirm.
fields.summary: User permissions ignored
Text statistics like word count, character count, etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7791].
  {panel}

Userlister is a great way to generate some dynamic content, however, it only ennumerates confluence useres and groups, not LDAP users and groups.

We would like, on the top page of each space, to list for our users (not withstanding page specific restrictions) the people / groups that will be able to read their content, the people that will be able to edit their content, and who to contanct for administrative requests.

Basically, it would be a view of the 'space admim - permissions' page that was not editable (and perhaps toned down as far as permission granularity).  A quick fix would be just to allow a read-only view of the permissions page accessbile to non-administrators.  You could have a checkbox that the adminsitrator could check on the permissions tab that reads "Allow non-administrators to view space permissions', or viewing space permissions could be a permission attribute itself.

Ideally, however, it would simplify the view so that you just listed Administrators and/or Space Administrators, the groups that can EDIT, the groups that can VIEW.

Great product, keep the enhancments coming!

Thanks!
fields.summary: Userlister should provide list of NAMES or LDAP GROUPS that have ADMINISTRATOR / EDIT / READ permissions in a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7789].
  {panel}

Wikipedia (Mediawiki) search has both a "Search" and a "Go" button.  Search works a lot like the Confluence search, but Go looks for a single page with an exact title match (aided a lot by user creation of redirect pages) and takes the user to that page if it exists.  This is the biggest frustration our users have.  Salespeople and others looking for glossary-type pages want to type, say, "Postgres" and have a definitive Postgres page returned that defines the term.  I asked about this on the forums a while back, so here's a possible (very) high-level spec that I think  would work:

* Add a Go button to the main search box in front of the Search button, and give the Go button the focus so it's used by default.
* When the user clicks "Go" instead of Search, the search is assumed to be a title search and a request for an exact phrase match, and to be a Pages search only.
* If there is a single result, the system immediately redirects the user to the page that matched the search.
* If there are multiple pages with the same title and one of them is in the same space the user searched from, the system redirects the user to that page.
* If there are multiple pages with the same title and none are is the space the user search from, or if the user searched from the dashboard, show the regular search results page.
* If there are no exact titles matches, execute a regular search and show the result.  Ideally this also would default to searching the current space, which I believe is another request.

People would go nuts over this - guaranteed!  Please add it ...
fields.summary: Search yielding an exact title match should redirect to the desired page, like Wikipedia

fields.description:
When using the insert link dialog, blog posts (and probably attachments) don't show up properly anymore.

On the extranet, search for "6 ideas improving confluence support" in all spaces, then search for it in an insert link dialog. The first brings up Dave Soul's internal blog post (which I'm trying to link to), the second brings up nothing.
fields.summary: Insert link dialog doesn't search properly

fields.description:
The 2.3.1 build#643 is missing the velocity templates for junitreport macros. 

We had a 2.2.7 version installed, where this macro was working. After upgrading to 2.3.1, it stopped working. The log compaints about missing templates.

After copying the following from the previous Confleunce install (2.2.7), the macro works. The following files were missing in the WEB-INF/classes/templates/macros directory:

fatcowcontroller.vm
fatcowproperties.vm
fatcowreport.vm
fatcowsuitereport.vm
fatcowsuitesummary.vm
fatcowtable.vm
fields.summary: junitreport macro doesnt work on version 2.3.1 build#643

fields.description:
I haven't been able to test this on a more recent version, but it definitely happens in 2.2.9. If someone is editing a page in their personal space, and forgets to save, they are prompted that a draft copy exists and would the like to recover it. So far, so good. The problem is, when they click to recover or trash the draft, a page comes up saying they don't have permission to do so.

A couple of things to note - the user in question is not an administrator, they are just a regular confluence user. This may or may not effect things...

I don't know if this has been solved in later versions, could you confirm this one way or the other?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Recovering a draft copy of a page in a personal space fails.

fields.description:
recently-updated macro displays all pages updated for given public wiki space (i.e. wiki space which is available to view by Anonymous users!)

But here is the problem:

Let's say there are few pages that are protected so that only users  from some user group can view or edit (restrictions set by editing given page). Any such pages if edited or modifed or if children pages created for such Parent page, then this information shouldn't be appear in recently-updated macro.

Right now whenever user make changes to such protected, page titles for such pages appear on Dashboard in recently-updated macro. Is there anyway we can prevent this thing happening ?

Also there should be global configuration setting so that any instance of {recently-updated} macro will not show updates for certain wiki spaces.

regards,
Rajendra
fields.summary: Pages which are protected in a public wiki space shouldn't appear in recently-updated macro

fields.description:
Currently all users of confluence are displayed in the people directory regardless of whether they are part of any user group or given any use permissions.
Ideally these inactive users should not be displayed if they are not part of any group or do not have any confluence use permissions.
fields.summary: People directory should not display inactive users

fields.description: When creating a space, there should be a way to select an existing space group.  If no space groups are available, this section of the form shouldn't appear.  The list should allow, if there are space groups, for "none" to be selected, since a space doesn't have to belong to a space group.
fields.summary: Add ability to select a space group in the create space form

fields.description: The atlassian-extras dependency should be upgraded to 0.7.32 from 0.7.25
fields.summary: Update atlassian-extras dependency to 0.7.32

fields.description:
Space groups should be accessible via the dashboard.  To make this happen, a new tab, named "Groups", should be added to the macro and it should only show up when one more Space Groups is available to the user.  In non-shared mode, all space groups will be accessible, whether they contain spaces or not.  In shared mode, only space groups that contain accessible spaces will be available.  The UI for browsing spaces in a group should resemble the UI for Teams.

This change should be 100% backwards compatible for the major of Confluence installations that don't use Space Groups.
fields.summary: Add "Groups" tab in space list macro on dashboard for Space Groups
When using a line break (\\) followed by a table, the table heading does not render properly due to additional characters

However the underlying error might be a to small column TRACKBACKLINKS.EXCERPT (see attached log file).
I've increased the column width, but now deleting the (partly) imported space now fails with some NPE (again, see log) so a cannot remove it.

Allow notifications to be sent when spaces are created
Introduce an easy method to select existing labels when using the RSS Feed Builder

fields.description:
Why is the plus \(+) sign an illegal character when uploading attachments, but when you save an attachment (or export as Word), all spaces are replaced by the plus sign? Can you change the behaviour to insert "%20" instead of "+"? Currently, you need to convert all plus signs to spaces before re-uploading an attachment that has been downloaded.

[ucdavis.edu]
fields.summary: Make the plus-sign a legal character for attachments

fields.description:
We should truncate email subjects that are longer than the database column (255 chars) rather than causing an exception, which stops other emails from getting imported.

See CSP-6722 for reference.
fields.summary: Truncate email subjects longer than 255 characters

fields.description:
If a user enters a heading an omits the space between the heading tag and the heading itself, the heading renders correctly, but the first word in the heading is not indexed. e.g.

h2.Purchase requests

"Purchase" won't be indexed, "requests" will be.

This is a problem because quite often the first word in a heading is an important keyword for that page.
fields.summary: Some headings render correctly but are not indexed in search

fields.description: Add an importSpace method to the RPC interfaces that takes a space XML export as a byte array, similar to the addAttachment method.
fields.summary: Add importSpace method to RPC interfaces

fields.description:
One of our many spaces displayed no pages when using Tree and Alphabetical views, but one can see some pages in recently updated view.  All other spaces were fine.  Reindexing did not help the issue.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Tree and alphabetical views display no pages, recently updated view shows some pages
Feature to queue a series of wiki space remove requests
Remove space is very slow and locks out all users while it is running

fields.description:
While editing a page in Rich Text mode, the inclusion of an invalid link causes the "link" parameter to duplicate for each time it is saved. Subsequently, a "[]" will be displayed after at least twice saving the page. 
For example, adding an invalid link in the page and saving the page numerous times results in:

"<alias>|^<invalid link>|^<invalid link>|..."  (depending on the number of times the page is saved)

to

"[ ]"
fields.summary: Duplication of invalid links while saving a page in Rich Text Editor
Add ability to copy templates

fields.description:
We should url encode spacekeys as personal spaces (due to username) can contain internationalised characters

This does not affect Tomcat but affects Websphere. 

See CSP-6416 for reference.
fields.summary: Url Encode spacekey

fields.description:
A slightly useless issue, since I'm not sure if I can reproduce it. However:
 
This is the error I got while upgrading from 2.2 to 2.3.1:
2007-01-24 21:28:40,914 ERROR [Thread-1] [atlassian.confluence.plugin.ConfluencePluginManager] extractBundledPlugins Found atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip, but failed to read file

I found the atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip myself and extracted it to the plugins-bundled dir, and everything worked fine.

And no, I didn't have the file open :P

Maybe the issue is the silent failure, where certain (key) functionality isn't installed and I would be none the wiser if I didn't have a good look over the log files.
fields.summary: extractBundledPlugins Found atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip, but failed to read file

fields.description: Use the ConcurrentLuceneConnection class, as used by JIRA as the base class for ConfluenceLuceneConnection.
fields.summary: Don't block index readers during index updates and optimization

fields.description:
At the moment, if you have this in your atlassian-plugin.xml file: 

    <macro name="gmap" class="com.atlassian.confluence.ext.gmaps.GmapsMacro" key="gmap">
        <description>The individual map macro.</description>
    </macro>

    <component name="gmapsManager" class="com.atlassian.confluence.ext.gmaps.GmapsManager" key="gmapsManager"/>

And GmapsMacro depends on gmapsManager being injected, it will _not_ be. 

Wiring of spring beans declared inside plugins is broken.
fields.summary: Spring bean components in plugins do not get wired onto macros
RendererUtil.stripBasicMarkup doesn't strip {<style>} correctly

fields.description: Individual users can be added to the groups list under web space permissions.   (The user will be shown by their ldap name).    The same user can also be added to the  "Individual Users"  list and given a different set of permissions.
fields.summary: Individual users can be incorrectly added to Groups permission list for a space

fields.description:
Rather than ticking the 'comments' box including all comments, it should just include comments from the content types which have been selected (unless only comments has been ticked)

It makes no sense for a feed comprising 'news' and 'comments' to include comments on pages, IMHO.
fields.summary: RSS Feed should incude only comments of content included in feed
Search through space descriptions should include search of space names

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:  
* In a space called bar, create a link to a new page  [foo:some new page]
* Click the link to create it.  Notice that url indicates   spaceKey=foo  title=Some+New+Page
* Add some content.
* Click save
Notice from the breadcrumbs that the space was added to the system administrators personal space.
fields.summary: Creating links to new pages with explicit space keys causes the new page to be created in authors personal space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7742].
  {panel}

I would like to be possible to disable commenting on a page. Some pages (like main pages or portal pages) on a site don't need comments. It isn't appropriate. Not only can you not disable commenting on a page (like through a simple checkbox on the edit page), but even if you disable editing of a page entirely, that still won't prevent commenting.

Please improve this situation. Best of all would be a simple checkbox: [ ] Users can comment on this page. I would also be ok with tying it to page permissions.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 1st November,  2011|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi Everyone,
Thanks for all your feedback on this issue. After much discussion we've concluded we won't be implementing this feature request. Our goal is to continue to simplify the product, by focusing on building for the majority of our customers. Whilst the ability to disable comments on a specific page or blog is a completely valid feature request, we believe it just crosses the line in terms of adding an extra level of complexity to the product and is a use case that isn't catering for the majority of our customers.  

In saying this, there are several ways in which this can still be achieved. For example, David Simpson [has written up a blog post of how this can be done with a simple user macro on a page|http://davidsimpson.me/2011/01/23/more-flexible-commenting-in-atlassians-confluence/]. Alternatively you could write a plugin to hide the comments block on a page. We welcome the plugin developer community to tackle this problem as it won't be something we will make core to the product.  

Thanks for your patience with this issue. 

Cheers,
Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Manager
smansour at atlassian dot com

{panel}
fields.summary: Allow comments to be disabled on a page or blog post

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7741].
  {panel}

Pages can be moved individually, by parent-children thread, or by complete spaces. However if I wish to find and refactor pages according to specific criteria (for example using a keyword filter), I could generate an RSS feed or a list of pages from the search engine but cannot extract or move this list of pages together to another space.  (or correct me if there is some way unknown to me of doing so)

Such ability to refactor based on filters would enable information modelling and architecture. Existing engines such as the hyperapplet-plugin or Touchgraph could then be used to develop 3D and 4D navigation models from within Confluence (without going through the RPC interface).

Going further, the ability to dynamically mirror (virtual refactoring) the pages into specific filters would allow to build and embed various space navigation models into the wiki to best suit each users desired perspective (without duplicating/changing the actual pages).

I understand this may be going too much ahead for many users but our wiki has become so crowded with pages that the traditional navigation schemes are becoming inefficient. The search engine remains a good alternative but fails to show the inter-relations and global view of all available wiki pages. Therefore a solution is needed to FILTER/VIEW/NAVIGATE the wiki in a non-linear way.
fields.summary: Non-Linear Refactoring/Mirroring (for architecture modelling and visualization)
Allow authentication/authorization to be handled through GSSAPI, stopping the need to pop-up a logon dialogue.

fields.description:
Confluence only allows subtractive Inheritance of Permissions, so you can restrict more on subpages (at least with view permissions).
It would be good to have this additive. So there is a bunch of pages with read only rights and for specific users can have edit rights on subpages (and from that on, on all subpages of that page).

E.g.:

Space (Department f1) - Everyone can read
Subpage (Projects) - Everyone can read, dep. f1 can edit
SubSubpage (Project Installations) - Some additional Members of Department installation can edit here (and on subpages)
fields.summary: Inherit Page Permissions additiv (additional rights)

fields.description:
While editing under Internet Explorer in the Rich Text Editor, the editing screen scrolls to its first line as soon as the cursor passes over (without clicking) the other editor tabs, i.e. *Wiki Markup* and 'Preview' tabs. 

In the screen prints attached: 
  - "IExplorer Rich Text BEFORE.png" shows the Rich Text screen with the cursor (little hand) over edit buttons -- then displaying is normal, and shows the portion of the page where the text cursor was last found 
  - "IExplorer Rich Text AFTER.png" shows what happens when the cursor (little hand) travels over an edit tab (here, the Wiki Markup tab) -- we see the text scrolled up to "{column:width=95%}", which is Line 1 

(see CSP-6709 for images)

The said behaviour does NOT occur: 
  - when editing in the Wiki Markup Editor 
  - when editing with Mozilla Firefox 
  - when the cursor passes over other regions of the page 

Among others, the problem was detected under Microsoft Internet Explorer version used is: 6.0.2900.2180.xpsp_sp2_gdr.050301-1519
fields.summary: nder IExplorer, Rich Text Editor scrolls to top when cursor over other editor tabs

fields.description:
We are using subversion and I'd like to create a shortcut in Confluence to projects held in Subversion.  However I've noticed that shortcuts with certain characters in them do not resolve correctly.  The two problems in particular are those with a forward slash ('/') or a space ' ' in them.

Examples:
Shortcut is defined as:
Key: svn 
Expanded value: http://subversion.objective.com/svn_repos/

When I create a shortcut link:
[trunk/My Project@svn]

It resolves to:
http://subversion.objective.com/svn_repos/trunk%2FMy+Project

So the '/' is replaced with its hex value %2F, while the space is replaced with '+'.  if the space was replaced with it's hex character that would at least work, however the '/' is still the problem.
fields.summary: Shortcuts to with certain chars in them do not resolve correctly

fields.description:
Doug South:

"I have an issue with plugin development. If I load a plugin with errors, then uninstall the plugin and try to re-install an updated plugin, confluence doesn't seem to take the new install (or at least show the install) until I restart tomcat. Is there a better way to update a plugin that works well?"

fields.description:
When moving a page that contains somoe brackets (such as "[sql_procedure]") to a different space, the server will add a "SPACE_KEY:" inside each [ ].
This is done even if the brackets are escaped.

So in this case the page will ahve (after move) something like (assuming SPACE_KEY is DEV):
"[DEV:sql_procedure]"
fields.summary: Brackets are getting a SPACE_KEY: inserted when pages are moved across spaces

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a 'floatright' user macro that wraps its contents in <div align="right">
* Create a confluence page containing the following text:

=======

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Etiam nonummy, nunc vitae porta facilisis, tellus nisl laoreet dolor, sed tempor dolor est id justo. Aliquam erat volutpat. Nunc iaculis. Cras ornare odio id tellus. Pellentesque blandit, augue id hendrerit semper, nulla leo fringilla ante, vitae facilisis mauris quam vestibulum metus. Cras ornare ante at massa. Vestibulum neque. Nam suscipit, arcu tempus tristique vestibulum, sapien elit laoreet justo, vitae dictum nisl lorem sed augue. Sed tortor tellus, bibendum et, euismod sed, vestibulum a, turpis. Nullam ut tellus gravida nulla sollicitudin volutpat. Pellentesque iaculis ultrices tortor. Sed sodales placerat sem. Morbi pellentesque magna vitae nisi adipiscing dictum. Proin id sem et dolor faucibus eleifend. Quisque nisl quam, placerat ut, porttitor quis, iaculis at, ligula. Maecenas vestibulum, quam id bibendum ultricies, diam pede volutpat urna, in semper pede nisi at lectus. Etiam non est. Duis nec neque eget nisi convallis pellentesque.

{floatright}{color:red}This floats right{color:red}{floatright}

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Etiam nonummy, nunc vitae porta facilisis, tellus nisl laoreet dolor, sed tempor dolor est id justo. Aliquam erat volutpat. Nunc iaculis. Cras ornare odio id tellus. Pellentesque blandit, augue id hendrerit semper, nulla leo fringilla ante, vitae facilisis mauris quam vestibulum metus. Cras ornare ante at massa. Vestibulum neque. Nam suscipit, arcu tempus tristique vestibulum, sapien elit laoreet justo, vitae dictum nisl lorem sed augue. Sed tortor tellus, bibendum et, euismod sed, vestibulum a, turpis. Nullam ut tellus gravida nulla sollicitudin volutpat. Pellentesque iaculis ultrices tortor. Sed sodales placerat sem. Morbi pellentesque magna vitae nisi adipiscing dictum. Proin id sem et dolor faucibus eleifend. Quisque nisl quam, placerat ut, porttitor quis, iaculis at, ligula. Maecenas vestibulum, quam id bibendum ultricies, diam pede volutpat urna, in semper pede nisi at lectus. Etiam non est. Duis nec neque eget nisi convallis pellentesque.

======

* Edit this page in the rich text editor (make no changes, just hit save immediately)

Expected outcome:

* The red "Floats Right" text appears floating to the right of the second paragraph

Actual outcome:

* The red "Floats Right" is above the second paragraph

What's happening here is the RTE is inserting a "\\" after the end of the {floatright} macro. Since we interpret \\ to mean <br clear="all">, this clears the paragraph past the float of the macro.

The RTE seems to add these newlines in a bunch of places they're not necessary. We should err in favour of not adding newlines at natural paragraph breaks (i.e. where there's a double-linebreak already in the wiki code). It's better to accidentally lose a few double-newlines than to insert them.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor places extraneous \\ after block macro

fields.description:
occasionally, multiple watches exist in our installation for a given page for a given user.

One way to make this happen is to right-click and copy the url for the 'watch page' icon, then paste it into the address bar and navigate multiple times to the notification action for that page id.  I don't think it's limited to this, however, as it is quite frequent in our installation to have duplicate watches for some users.

relates to: http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CONTRB-33
fields.summary: duplicate 'watches' can exist for a given user/page pair

fields.description:
See Also: CONF-2925 and CONF-4244

I am watching a space, and I get daily updates of all changes in confluence, but I would also like to specifically add my watch to certain pages. However, when watching a space, the 'watch page' icon is not available. 

Two use cases: 

1) watchers on a page are listed using the {contributors} macro. My name does not appear. this is deceptive when the 'watchers' list is to notify people of who will be notified of changes. 

2) If I one day REMOVE my space watch, I would want certain pages that I am particularly interested in to remain 'watched'. As an admin, I watch spaces broadly at first until they take off of their own steam and a few key contributors are found. After the fact, however, there are a few pages that I'd still like to notify. 

For now, i'll mark them as favourites, but then they quickly fill up my 'favourites' list. 

Support also indicated that you can manually watch a page using it's page id:

http://localhost:8080/pages/addpagenotification.action?pageId=425986 

See also: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-6689
fields.summary: Cannot watch a page if already watching the space

fields.description:
we run about 10 sites on one instance of confluence.

* Sometimes one of the sites 'adopts' a different theme.
* Confluence space admin still says it is using the correct theme
* we can change the theme to something else, and then change back and it still remains the wrong theme.
* when we restart confluence the problem is fixed (it uses the correct theme), but then other spaces lose their themes.
* we then go through all the spaces and for any that are not showing any theme we re select them on the space admin.

this is annoying because we get told by our clients that their theme has changed or disappeared, and I don't really want to write monitoring software to check unique ids in each theme.

Cheers.
fields.summary: themes changing randomly and on restart

fields.description:
Currently 'remove comments' appear to be either all or none:
You can either remove all comments, including your own and others, or all comments are locked.

There should be a permission setting so that in a space users are able to REMOVE or EDIT their own comments, but not comments of others. 

One complication of this partial permission mode is nesting of comments by multiple users. However, it's not that complicated:  Comments can be considered to have automatically 'quoted' when they are replied to (although the content is not duplicated), so the parent's content can no longer be edited or removed until the child is removed.

In this way, in some spaces, comments should be final and only editable by an administrator, in some, they should be mutable by yourself, and in others, they should be mutable by others (either admins, moderators, or even everyone).
fields.summary: Admin cannot set permissions so that users can remove their own comments

fields.description:
Trying to find something which is not there take longer than something which is.
I had trouble believing that Confluence didn't support tables with cells which spanned multiple columns so a comment on this in the documentation would have saved some time.
fields.summary: Document how to make tables which span multiple columns or make it clear this cannot be done.
